{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Revenue Manager",
  "description": "Marriott International is a leading global Lodging company based in Bethesda, Maryland, USA, with more than 4,100 properties in 79 countries and reported revenues of nearly $14 billion in fiscal year 2014. Its heritage can be traced to a root beer stand opened in Washington, D.C., in 1927 by J. Willard and Alice S. Marriott.

Marriott has more than 361,000 people working worldwide at managed or franchised properties and corporate offices. Marriott has been consistently recognized as a top employer and for its superior business ethics. The company also manages the award-winning guest loyalty program, Marriott Rewards&reg; and The Ritz-Carlton Rewards&reg; program, which together surpass 49M members.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Assistant Revenue Manager

Job ID:&nbsp;26005766
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Career area:&nbsp;Revenue Management

Job Purpose


	To support the development and execution of revenue management strategies that maximize market share and profitability.
	This involves daily monitoring of inventory, competitor pricing analysis, and demand forecasting to ensure the &quot;right product is sold to the right customer at the right time.&quot;


Key Responsibilities


	Data Analysis &amp; Reporting: Prepare and analyze daily, weekly, and monthly revenue reports (e.g., RevPAR, ADR, and Occupancy for hotels). Identify trends and anomalies in booking patterns.
	Pricing &amp; Inventory Management: Assist in setting daily BAR (Best Available Rate) and managing inventory across all distribution channels (OTAs, GDS, and Direct).
	Market Intelligence: Monitor competitor pricing and local market demand (events, holidays, etc.) to recommend strategic adjustments.
	Forecasting: Assist in the preparation of monthly and annual revenue forecasts and budgets.
	Channel Management: Ensure price parity across all third-party platforms and troubleshoot any connectivity issues between the Property Management System (PMS) and Channel Managers.
	Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Reservations teams to align promotional offers with revenue goals.


Required Skills &amp; Qualifications


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Hospitality Management, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Experience: 2&ndash;4 years of experience in revenue management, reservations, or front office operations.
	Technical Proficiency: Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (Pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, formulas).
	
		Experience with Revenue Management Systems (e.g., IDeaS, Duetto) and PMS (e.g., Opera).
	
	
	Analytical Mindset: Ability to translate complex data sets into actionable business insights.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-28",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Assistant Revenue Manager Job at Marriott International




        
    

        
        Marriott International is a leading global Lodging company based in Bethesda, Maryland, USA, with more than 4,100 properties in 79 countries and reported revenues of nearly $14 billion in fiscal year 2014. Its heritage can be traced to a root beer stand opened in Washington, D.C., in 1927 by J. Willard and Alice S. Marriott.

Marriott has more than 361,000 people working worldwide at managed or franchised properties and corporate offices. Marriott has been consistently recognized as a top employer and for its superior business ethics. The company also manages the award-winning guest loyalty program, Marriott Rewards® and The Ritz-Carlton Rewards® program, which together surpass 49M members.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Assistant Revenue Manager

Job ID: 26005766
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Career area: Revenue Management

Job Purpose


	To support the development and execution of revenue management strategies that maximize market share and profitability.
	This involves daily monitoring of inventory, competitor pricing analysis, and demand forecasting to ensure the "right product is sold to the right customer at the right time."


Key Responsibilities


	Data Analysis & Reporting: Prepare and analyze daily, weekly, and monthly revenue reports (e.g., RevPAR, ADR, and Occupancy for hotels). Identify trends and anomalies in booking patterns.
	Pricing & Inventory Management: Assist in setting daily BAR (Best Available Rate) and managing inventory across all distribution channels (OTAs, GDS, and Direct).
	Market Intelligence: Monitor competitor pricing and local market demand (events, holidays, etc.) to recommend strategic adjustments.
	Forecasting: Assist in the preparation of monthly and annual revenue forecasts and budgets.
	Channel Management: Ensure price parity across all third-party platforms and troubleshoot any connectivity issues between the Property Management System (PMS) and Channel Managers.
	Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Reservations teams to align promotional offers with revenue goals.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Experience: 2–4 years of experience in revenue management, reservations, or front office operations.
	Technical Proficiency: Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (Pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, formulas).
	
		Experience with Revenue Management Systems (e.g., IDeaS, Duetto) and PMS (e.g., Opera).
	
	
	Analytical Mindset: Ability to translate complex data sets into actionable business insights.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Cobranet Limited; a reputable organization incorporated in 2003 and provides internet solutions. Our footprint and range of products have grown immensely since incorporation and we are proud to provide every segment of society with a reliable link to the digital universe.

Our entire network topology is rugged, dynamic and fully redundant with negligible downtimes: content showing extremely high availability exceeding 99.5%. Our promise is to continue providing innovative solutions at the best feature-to-price and service-to-price ratio.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain customer accounts
	Handle transactions, invoices, and payments
	Reconcile accounts and resolve discrepancies
	Provide excellent customer service
	Prepare reports and statements
	Assist in account audits and compliance.


Requirements


	A minimum of B.Sc Degree or it equivalent in Accounting or finance background
	A minimum of 3 - 5 years of Cognate experience in Accounting or Finance.
	Experience with accounting software
	Attention to detail and analytical skills
	Good communication skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and&nbsp;qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@cobranet.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Account Officer Job at Cobranet Limited




        
    

        
        Cobranet Limited; a reputable organization incorporated in 2003 and provides internet solutions. Our footprint and range of products have grown immensely since incorporation and we are proud to provide every segment of society with a reliable link to the digital universe.

Our entire network topology is rugged, dynamic and fully redundant with negligible downtimes: content showing extremely high availability exceeding 99.5%. Our promise is to continue providing innovative solutions at the best feature-to-price and service-to-price ratio.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain customer accounts
	Handle transactions, invoices, and payments
	Reconcile accounts and resolve discrepancies
	Provide excellent customer service
	Prepare reports and statements
	Assist in account audits and compliance.


Requirements


	A minimum of B.Sc Degree or it equivalent in Accounting or finance background
	A minimum of 3 - 5 years of Cognate experience in Accounting or Finance.
	Experience with accounting software
	Attention to detail and analytical skills
	Good communication skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@cobranet.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Lead",
  "description": "KPMG is a global network of independent professional services firm with deep expertise in the provision of audit, tax and advisory services to clients in various industries and sectors of the economy. The Firm is well represented in Nigeria and across the African continent, with the objective of providing exceptional and quality services to multinational, regional and local clients and to enhance the product offerings in certain previously under-serviced markets.

We are recruiting to fill position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Operations Lead

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	As Operations Lead, you will lead manufacturing and operations, oversee supply chain, quality, and product development. You will ensure timely delivery, Good Manufacturing Practice/regulatory compliance, drive cost savings, and support faster product launches for local and international markets.


Key Requirements


	5 &ndash; 8 years of operations experience in beauty/FMCG.
	Strong background in supply chain, production planning, inventory, and third party Logistics.
	Proven cost savings delivery without compromising quality.
	Knowledge of cosmetic/home fragrance regulations.
	Solid Quality Assurance / Quality Control and SOP implementation experience.
	Strong leadership and cross-functional collaboration skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;chinelo.egbunine@ng.kpmg.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "KPMG"
    
  },

Operations Lead Job at KPMG




        
    

        
        KPMG is a global network of independent professional services firm with deep expertise in the provision of audit, tax and advisory services to clients in various industries and sectors of the economy. The Firm is well represented in Nigeria and across the African continent, with the objective of providing exceptional and quality services to multinational, regional and local clients and to enhance the product offerings in certain previously under-serviced markets.

We are recruiting to fill position below:

Job Position: Operations Lead

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	As Operations Lead, you will lead manufacturing and operations, oversee supply chain, quality, and product development. You will ensure timely delivery, Good Manufacturing Practice/regulatory compliance, drive cost savings, and support faster product launches for local and international markets.


Key Requirements


	5 – 8 years of operations experience in beauty/FMCG.
	Strong background in supply chain, production planning, inventory, and third party Logistics.
	Proven cost savings delivery without compromising quality.
	Knowledge of cosmetic/home fragrance regulations.
	Solid Quality Assurance / Quality Control and SOP implementation experience.
	Strong leadership and cross-functional collaboration skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chinelo.egbunine@ng.kpmg.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Data Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Job


	Design, build, and operate the MVNO&rsquo;s data lakehouse and pipelines to ensure secure, reliable, and governable data flow for analytics, regulatory, and operational needs.


Responsibilities
Data Pipeline Development and Management:


	Architect, develop, and maintain batch and real-time ingestion pipelines (Kafka, Airflow/Flink) from BSS/OSS, CDRs, CRM, and external sources into the lakehouse.
	Collaborate with Analysts and Data Scientists to productionise transformations and feature engineering.


Data Quality, Compliance and Monitoring:


	Implement data quality, schema validation, and monitoring to guarantee data fitness for purpose and compliance with NCC data regulations.
	Monitor pipeline health purely through metadata (job status, row counts, latency) and surface SLA dashboards while guaranteeing data sovereignty.


Data Storage and Optimization:


	Manage object storage, Delta/Iceberg tables, and warehouse schemas; optimize partitioning and performance.


Infrastructure Optimization and DevOps:


	Automate CI/CD deployment of data pipelines using Infrastructure as Code and GitOps best practices.


Governance &amp; Security:


	Own cost governance and access control policies across data platforms.


Requirements
General Education:


	Bachelor&#39;s or Master&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.


General Experience:


	Minimum 7 years of designing and operating data pipelines and lakehouses in telecom, fintech, or comparable data?intensive industries.
	Experience mentoring junior engineers or leading small project teams is desirable.
	Hands-on with streaming (Kafka/Flink/Pulsar) and batch orchestration (Airflow/Prefect).
	Expertise in SQL, Python/Scala, and Delta Lake/Iceberg/Hudi table formats.
	Proficiency in cloud object storage and data warehouse platforms (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
	Strong grasp of data quality frameworks (Great Expectations), CI/CD, Terraform, Docker/Kubernetes.

Data Engineer Job at Interswitch




        
    

        
        Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Data Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

About the Job


	Design, build, and operate the MVNO’s data lakehouse and pipelines to ensure secure, reliable, and governable data flow for analytics, regulatory, and operational needs.


Responsibilities
Data Pipeline Development and Management:


	Architect, develop, and maintain batch and real-time ingestion pipelines (Kafka, Airflow/Flink) from BSS/OSS, CDRs, CRM, and external sources into the lakehouse.
	Collaborate with Analysts and Data Scientists to productionise transformations and feature engineering.


Data Quality, Compliance and Monitoring:


	Implement data quality, schema validation, and monitoring to guarantee data fitness for purpose and compliance with NCC data regulations.
	Monitor pipeline health purely through metadata (job status, row counts, latency) and surface SLA dashboards while guaranteeing data sovereignty.


Data Storage and Optimization:


	Manage object storage, Delta/Iceberg tables, and warehouse schemas; optimize partitioning and performance.


Infrastructure Optimization and DevOps:


	Automate CI/CD deployment of data pipelines using Infrastructure as Code and GitOps best practices.


Governance & Security:


	Own cost governance and access control policies across data platforms.


Requirements
General Education:


	Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.


General Experience:


	Minimum 7 years of designing and operating data pipelines and lakehouses in telecom, fintech, or comparable data?intensive industries.
	Experience mentoring junior engineers or leading small project teams is desirable.
	Hands-on with streaming (Kafka/Flink/Pulsar) and batch orchestration (Airflow/Prefect).
	Expertise in SQL, Python/Scala, and Delta Lake/Iceberg/Hudi table formats.
	Proficiency in cloud object storage and data warehouse platforms (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
	Strong grasp of data quality frameworks (Great Expectations), CI/CD, Terraform, Docker/Kubernetes.


Note: Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the CEO

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time
Industry: Construction &amp; Real Estate

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking to hire an executive assistant. The Executive Assistant to the CEO will provide high-level administrative and operational support, ensuring the CEO&rsquo;s office runs efficiently.
	The role requires strong organizational skills, discretion, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced construction and real estate environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the CEO&rsquo;s calendar, meetings, travel, and correspondence
	Conduct research, prepare reports, presentations, and briefing documents
	Coordinate internal and external meetings and follow-ups
	Monitor and respond to emails
	Handling expense report and budgets
	Act as a liaison between the CEO and stakeholders
	Maintain confidential records and sensitive information
	Support office administration and special projects as assigned


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering or Architecture (First Class Graduates)
	Minimum of 4 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role
	Strong analytical, organizational, communication, and time management skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google workspace and other productivity tools
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality
	Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to draft professional correspondence and prepare polished materials.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Executive Assistant to the CEO Job at Zaventra Solutions




        
    

        
        Zaventra Solutions - Our client, a reputable firm in the construction and Real Estate sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the CEO

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time
Industry: Construction & Real Estate

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Our client is seeking to hire an executive assistant. The Executive Assistant to the CEO will provide high-level administrative and operational support, ensuring the CEO’s office runs efficiently.
	The role requires strong organizational skills, discretion, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced construction and real estate environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the CEO’s calendar, meetings, travel, and correspondence
	Conduct research, prepare reports, presentations, and briefing documents
	Coordinate internal and external meetings and follow-ups
	Monitor and respond to emails
	Handling expense report and budgets
	Act as a liaison between the CEO and stakeholders
	Maintain confidential records and sensitive information
	Support office administration and special projects as assigned


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Architecture (First Class Graduates)
	Minimum of 4 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role
	Strong analytical, organizational, communication, and time management skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google workspace and other productivity tools
	High level of professionalism and confidentiality
	Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to draft professional correspondence and prepare polished materials.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: zaventrasolutions@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
